name: Saltwater Marshes
economy_niches: reedcrafts, thatch and levee timbers for shipyards
piloted tidal-channel transport and navigational-augury services
culture_adjustments: stronger Sea-Tide ritualism centered on tide-offerings and marsh-spirits
kinship organized around salt-worker households rather than inland clan hierarchies
port-dialect enriched with saltwork and reedcraft technical registers
practical adaptation to recurrent flooding reduces land-ownership ceremonialism
constraints: thin, saline soils â€” limited arable land
ritual magic dependent on scarce imported reagents
notes: saltworks bound by state contracts and tax levies
local augury workshops specialize in tide prediction for pans
reedbeds are strategic resources for levees and roofing
